title: Me Before You

review.summary: The reviewer did not expect to enjoy a sappy romance film but was moved by Emilia Clarke’s performance and the film’s emotional tone.
review.reason_for_watching: Emilia Clarke’s acting in Game of Thrones

female_lead.name: Emilia Clarke
female_lead.comparison_to_previous_roles: Drastically different from her stoic GoT character

supporting_cast: Matthew Lewis (Neville Longbottom from Harry Potter)

issues: Too many cuts during certain emotional scenes
Distracting editing during mansion arrival and bench scene

locations: Modern luxurious house with smart architecture

themes.romance: Quirky, light-hearted love story with deep emotional beats

ethics.conflict: Whether a person with a diminished but stable condition should be allowed assisted death
ethics.exploration: Raises moral, ethical, spiritual and legal questions about autonomy in choosing death

disability.portrayal: Balanced, empathetic look at life with quadriplegia
disability.support_system: Nurse, converted home, emotional support from Lou (Clarke)

tone.specific_moments: Somber yet humorous due to Clarke’s energy

conclusion: Surprisingly heartfelt and charming, elevated by strong performances and ethical depth. Recommended both as a romance and a philosophical exploration.
